name: Acts of Random Kindness
description: Our club is centered around making people smile with gifts and activities that they aren't expecting! We hope to make students and staff feel seen and appreciated while making friends along the way!

name: Animal Shelter Alliance
description: As a club, we raise awareness for the humane society and advocate care for homeless animals. We help out multiple shelters through teamwork and volunteering, including making toys and treats for homeless pets.

name: Asian American Alliance
description: Mason’s Asian American Alliance aims to provide a safe space for all types of Asian students who attend our school through cultural nights and sharing of activities. We want to promote diversity and work together to stop asian hate in our community.

name: ASL Club and Honor Society
description: For those interested in taking ASL who couldn't get into the class to learn about ASL and Deaf culture / community. Those that are ASL Honor Society members will participate in club and Honor Society hour fulfillment will be discussed

name: Black Student Union
description: The Black Student Union is committed to highlighting and uplifting the varied realities of the African American experiences within our community.
sectionOneContent: The MHS Black Student Union maintains that a multicultural and just community is the penultimate goal, however, we also recognize that the African American experience is a unique one, specifically in a predominantly white community. Therefore, we recognize the need to create a safe and affirming space, specifically geared to African American/Black students that speaks to their heritage, culture and history. By intentionally curating this community, we hope to form bonds between Black students that are, at times, hard to create given how we have been dispersed in the diaspora.  Consequently, the Black Student Union is critical to maintain, sustain, buttress and bolster African American students. We affirm our commitment to highlighting and uplifting the varied realities of the African American experiences within our community.  We recognize and affirm that everyone has a unique perspective and lens through which they engage the world.  We welcome all allies who are genuinely willing to support the organization by utilizing their time and talent for the uplifting of future leaders at MHS and beyond.

name: Blankets for Benefit
description: Blankets for Benefit is a club for anyone who wants to make a difference while having fun! We make fabric tie blankets and donate them to local hospitals, homeless shelters, and foster agencies. Help the community and have fun making blankets! No experience necessary and no mandatory meetings.

name: Cards for a Cause
description: We are a community service club that hand-makes cards or other small gifts for local hospitals, senior living centers, nonprofit organizations, etc. Members may make cards at home and drop them off in B310 or sign up for Mrs. Cronin's connect session! This will also count for volunteer hours. Anyone can join at any time, and there are no mandatory meetings. You can contact us at mhscfac@masonohioschools.com

name: Comet Crochet and Knitting
description: Comet Crochet and Knitting provides a place for students to meet others with a shared interest in crochet or knitting. Members can work on individual crochet/knitting projects, or work on club projects. We give back to the Mason community through donations of crocheted or knitted items to local nonprofits, shelters, and charities. Students with no experience knitting or crocheting but are interested in learning are welcome to join!

name: Comets in Action
description: The mission of the Comets in Action (C.I.A.) club is to create an environment in which all students, those with and without disabilities, have opportunities to build rewarding friendships with peers at Mason High School.

name: Computer Science Honor Society
description: The National Computer Science Honor Society is a club that  encourages enthusiasm for computer science and promotes and recognizes academic excellence and service among high school computer science students.

name: Computer Science Honors Society
description: We are a community service based club regarding computer science. We encourage students' enthusiasm for computer science, honors academic excellence, and promote service. Members have outstanding performance, dedication, and contributions to our community which help foster knowledge of computer science and STEM. Accepting sophomores and up!

name: Environmental Club
description: Our mission is to educate the student body, spread awareness, and take direct action on environmental issues/injustices in hopes of becoming a more eco-friendly and environmentally-conscious Mason.We aim to accomplish this through educational campaigns, social media posts and infographics, hosting events/projects, pledges, and running fundraisers.

name: FBLA (Future Business Leaders of America)
description:
FBLA is the largest business Career and Technical Student Organization in the World. FBLA's mission is to inspire and prepare students to become community-minded business leaders in a global society through relevant career preparation and leadership experiences. FBLA aims to develop competent, aggressive business leadership, strengthen the confidence of students in themselves and in their work, encourage members to pursue individual projects for the betterment of their community, encourage scholarship and promote school loyalty and develop character, prepare for useful citizenship, and foster patriotism among many others.

Students will have the opportunity to prove their knowledge and technical expertise in a vast variety of business-related skills at Ohio's State Leadership Conference in the Spring, and will have the chance to get nationally recognized at FBLA's National Leadership Conference in the Summer.

name: Film Club
description: Film Club meets regularly to watch movies and discuss them.

name: Genes in Disease and Symptoms (GIDAS)
description: GIDAS is a genetic research-based club that focuses on bringing medical research to high school students. We work to bring awareness around genetics through guest speakers, hands-on labs, and fun activities together. Come join us and learn about the fascinating world of genetics!

name: Global Language Initiative
description: GLI is all about learning and teaching languages while also sharing aspects of cultures with other students in Mason. This is the perfect club for you if you want to learn a new language, practice one that you know, teach someone else the languages you know, or learn about other countries and cultures. This club is a great way to make friends while learning a brand new skill. The club offers multiple languages ranging from Spanish to Turkish to Mandarin Chinese to Korean to Arabic to Tamil and Hindi. We aim to share the love of language learning with everyone at Mason! Global awareness and compassion starts here!

name: Goods 4 Good
description: Goods 4 Good will be a low commitment club that will meet 2 times a month. During the meetings, we will make sandwiches/meals which will be donated to a homeless shelter. Club members will have the option to sign up and bring in ingredients to be used for making meals.

name: GSA
description: Mason High School Gender Sexuality Alliance.  Discuss LGBTQ+ topics in a safe and inviting space. Meetings on select Wednesday after school in C108. See Schoology for more details.

name: Hope Squad
description:
Hope Squad is a peer-to-peer suicide prevention program. Students are trained in QPR (question-persuade-refer) and SOS (signs of suicide) so that they can identify a friend in crisis and refer them to a mental health professional. Students are nominated to Hope Squad by their peers and meet as a class during the school day.

Students in need of support can reach a Hope Squad member through the peer connection form: https://forms.gle/oD2GpXFVez1eekXn6

name: HOSA
description: HOSA is a global student-led organization recognized by the U.S. Department of Education and the Department of Health and Human Services and several federal and state agencies. HOSA’s mission is to empower HOSA-Future Health Professionals to become leaders in the global health community, through education, collaboration, and experience. HOSA actively promotes career opportunities in the health industry and to enhance the delivery of quality health care to all people. HOSA provides a unique program of leadership development, motivation, and recognition exclusively for students enrolled in health science education and biomedical science programs or have interests in pursuing careers in health professions. HOSA is 100% health care!

name: Humans of Mason High
description: Humans of Mason High is an Instagram page and podcast dedicated to the idea that everyone has a story to share. Inspired by Humans of New York—a digital photoblog that shares the stories of everyday citizens—our club has a conversation with an MHS student or staff member each week and features them through a social media post. These posts include a picture of the individual and a caption about any aspect of their background (passions, perspectives, or experiences) as told by them. Through this page, we hope to enable our community to learn about the diverse lives behind all the unfamiliar faces in the hallways, ultimately encouraging connection and empathy at our large high school.

name: Ice Hockey
description: We are an OHSAA sanctioned athletic team that competes with other high schools in the state. We offer options for both JV and Varsity teams and have a mix of experienced and beginner players. Whether you have been playing your whole life, or just want to get started, we would love to have you.

name: International Club
description: International Club is a globally-oriented organization. We focus on cultures around the world, while also conducting leadership and service projects to help the community like the Taste of Mason.

name: Investment Club
description:
Here at Investment Club we strive to educate the investors of the future on the valuable methods, practices and, info in regards to all aspects of investments. 
At investment club you will work alongside like-minded peers to further your knowledge of the stocks, bonds, ETFs, real estate and more, under the careful guidance of an experienced leadership team and various industry-professional guests and speakers.

name: Japan Club
description: Japan club is a place to learn about the culture of the Japanese people. We want to spread the knowledge of the country, and try new things. We will do origami, and calligraphy and have a tea ceremony. It is a club for everyone!

name: Key club
description: Key Club is a service oriented international organization. It's focus centers on character development through to the community at large. It's mission is to help others in need through a variety of service events and projects. As a team, we work together to make a difference both locally and internationally. We value leadership, character building, and inclusiveness in welcoming those from all backgrounds interested in contributing to the community.

name: Live Music Club
description: The live music club, AKA the AMs, is a band that plays live shows before school in the front lobby once a month or so, as well as other gigs such as the Talent Show. This club meets from 2:45-4:30 PM on Fridays throughout the school year. All instruments are welcome, but all members should be somewhat skilled on their instrument and have a basic knowledge of music theory. Membership is limited for this club, so auditions for new members are held at the beginning of the school year.

name: Mason A Cappella
description:
The MHS Contemporary A Cappella Program is made up of two auditioned ensembles (NOTEORIOUS & SIREN), which meet after school and/or during evening hours.  Students selected for this ensemble will have demonstrated proper vocal technique, sight singing, and ear training skills and appropriate rehearsal/performance discipline.  Repertoire studied will be of varying difficulty levels in the pop/jazz style.  Students selected must be available for mandatory rehearsals beginning in early August and must also be available for after school and evening rehearsals, public performances, and competitions throughout the year. Students can earn 0.5 performing arts credit for this ensemble.
Grade Level:    9-12
Prerequisites:  Audition, Must be enrolled in a curricular MHS choir, band, or orchestra and have Choral Director recommendation.

name: Mason Academic Team
description:
Think Jeopardy!, but working in a team of four players.
Questions drawn from multitude of categories
Academic subjects, trivia, sports, pop culture, etc.
Compete against other high schools under two formats (OAC and NAQT)

name: Mason Chemistry Club
description: Mason Chemistry Club is dedicated to the appreciation and exploration of chemistry beyond the classroom. Members will have the opportunity to participate in unique labs, learn new topics, and engage in problem solving with like-minded peers. Meeting focuses vary; some may be geared towards members preparing for various chemistry competitions, while others may be appropriate for all levels of chemistry. Interested? Join our Schoology page for further updates!

name: Mason Comets Sports Radio
description: Mason Comets Sports Radio broadcasts and promotes Mason Comets athletics. The group brings together broadcasters, graphic designers, animators,  music creators, video producers, and sports enthusiasts to create content to promote and spread information about the athletes and teams at Mason High School.

name: Mason Drama Club
description: Our club puts on the extra-curricular theater productions at Mason High School.  We do three shows a year, two plays in the fall and winter, and a musical in the spring.  We have over 200 students who participate each year, and positions for both actors and theater technicians.

name: Mason Hack Club
description:
Mason Hack Club is a computer programming club and is a chapter of the international Hack Club organization. We meet every Wednesday in room B112.

Our weekly meetings include a wide array of computer science topics for our members to explore and learn. These topics include cybersecurity, web design, database management, Raspberry Pi computing, and many, many more! Members of Mason Hack Club not only get to learn about amazing CS topics, but they also get to compete against their peers, connect with companies, volunteer for the community, and showcase their awesome projects.

Mason Hack Club's main goal is to help students of all ages learn about computer programming through teaching workshops and building a community where students can share their passion for coding.

Over the years, we've hosted and helped organize several events, such as our yearly hackathon CincyHacks.

Mason Hack Club is sponsored by Cengage Learning.

name: Mason High School Chess Team
description: The Mason High School Chess Team competes in the Greater Miami Conference against the other 9 GMC schools in 14 matches per season.  Although we can and do accept relative beginners onto the team, the primary purpose of the team is for those who already know how to play chess to improve and become better players.  Our team represents Mason HS in the conference and sometimes at State and National competitions.
sectionOneContent: Our season takes place mostly on Tuesday and Thursday afternoons from early October through early December.  We have some team practices; of those, certain ones might be deemed optional while others are mandatory.  Players who are in competition for a starting spot in the varsity lineup must attend “internal playoff” rounds that are scheduled.
sectionTwoContent: The top 5 players compete in matches, with the strongest player competing on board #1, the second on board #2, etc.  We play a JV match consisting of however many extra players each school has available on a particular day.  There are 9 regular season matches, with around half of those being at home and half being away.  For away matches, we take a bus after school.
sectionThreeContent: The season concludes with the top 7 players missing school for a full day to compete in the 2nd round of GMC competition, an all-day event held at another GMC school.  Players have an opportunity to earn 1st- or 2nd-team all-GMC and to help their team and school to earn points for the All-Sports Trophy in the conference.  Players on the team are typically serious enough about chess to be U. S. Chess Federation (USCF) members and to consider playing and competing for State or National Championships outside of the school season.  USCF membership is not required for the team but is strongly encouraged.

name: Mason High School Honor Society
description: Mason High School Honor Society is a club focused on promoting community service and leadership at Mason High School.

name: Mason High School Pickleball Club
description: This club will allow students to play pickleball once a week at the Pickle Lodge in West Chester throughout the entire school year. We will be playing every Wednesday from 4-5pm. Cost is $10 per player. Sign up is first come first serve basis. Transportation is NOT provided. Final Forms must be completed before participation. Instruction is provided at an extra cost.
additionalTitle: Parent of Bradley Curtiss (works at ME)
sectionOneContent: You will be emailed directions on how to register with The Pickle Lodge. Payment will be done through them and not the school.

name: Mason HS Ski Club
description: Members of the Mason HS Ski Club hop on a charter bus and go skiing after school on 4 Mondays in January / February at Perfect North.  This club is perfect for skiing novices and experienced skiers.   Rentals and lessons can be purchased through Perfect North.  Ski safety is emphasized and a culture of skiing camaraderie is fostered.

name: Mason Inclusion Club
description: Take the MIC with Mason Inclusion Club! Meetings include social justice based discussion, campaigns, fundraisers, and volunteering to make every student at MHS feel included. Join us in B312 every other Wednesday to be part of the conversation!

name: Mason Indian Youth Association (MIYA)
description: MIYA is a club that is centered around the cultural diversity of India. It is a place to celebrate and appreciate everyone within the Indian community, as well as create a safe space to relax and have fun. By leading activities that are inclusive to all parts of India, we are creating this safe space to people of Indian heritage, along with people interested in the Indian culture.

name: Mason IYNA
description: Mason High School's Neuroscience club, where we seek to foster interest in the field of Neuroscience through the International Youth Neuroscience Association. Meetings every other Wednesday.

name: Mason Origami Club
description: MHS Origami Club aims to create paper projects like origami to provide a safe space to share the craft of paper crafts from multiple cultures and help students destress. In the future, we plan to help out with decorations in partnership with other school clubs. We also would love to larger projects with local organizations to lift the spirits of our community! MHS Origami Club aims to be a peaceful and collaborative place to make new friends while helping out with a cause. We hope you can join us!

name: Mason Speech & Debate Team
description: Mason Speech & Debate is a competitive academic organization at MHS that competes in various tournaments throughout the state. With 12 different events to choose from, everyone can find their niche within our team and compete in an event that suits their interest. Regardless of the event chosen, students will vastly increase their public speaking capabilities, confidence, and analytical thinking. Weekly tournaments throughout the winter build high team morale and a strong community of like-minded, passionate students.

name: Mason Ultimate Frisbee Club
description: Ultimate is a sport that inspires players and fans alike because of its ability to develop and showcase the athleticism, skill, teamwork, and character of its participants. As a low-cost sport requiring minimal equipment, offering single and mixed-gender play, and providing a format that builds communication and conflict resolution skills, Ultimate provides a welcoming, high value experience for players and fans from a diverse set of backgrounds and experiences. Spirit of the Game is a set of principles which places the responsibility for fair play on the player. Highly competitive play is encouraged, but never at the expense of mutual respect among competitors, adherence to the agreed upon rules, or the basic joy of play.

name: Math Team
description: Enjoy the challenge of mathematics; Test your mathematical skills amongst peers inside and outside of Mason High; Collaborate/teach/learn new mathematical techniques

name: MBC
description: MBC (Mason Broadcast Crew) (Audio-Visual Club) - produces broadcast content. The MBC News program is produced by students enrolled in the Integrated Media Internship and the Integrated Media Advanced Production Lab. You don't have to be a student in media courses to participate in many of the broadcast productions. Student volunteers and media students partner to produce the video yearbook that is shown to students at the conclusion of the school year. Students in this program get to use a variety of production technology, like video cameras, microphones, wireless microphones and video editing software.

name: MEAid
description: MEAid aims to increase awareness about human injustice in the Middle East, particularly focusing on hospitality issues. Additionally, we plan to raise funds and donate them to health organizations to support Middle East refugees.

name: Mentoring Mason Men (MMM)
description: MMM is all about hanging out with the guys after school. We pair up students with special needs with a peer mentor and play games, watch movies, etc.

name: MHS (Taylor's Version)
description: Do you love Taylor Swift and want to connect with other Swifties at MHS?  The Taylor Swift Club is the best way to do that!  During meetings we will theorize, analyze lyrics and albums, rank songs, and have a great time.

name: MHS Aerospace Flight Club
description: This club is for anyone interested in aerospace, aviation, and aircraft/spacecraft. We will be meeting every two weeks from 2:30 to 3:30. In these meetings we will be learning about flight fundamentals, using flight simulators to learn how to fly, completing fun experiments and competing in engaging engineering challenges against one another for prizes. There will be lots of opportunities to build and fly model airplanes and rockets. We will also have speakers who have been/are in the aerospace field come in and share their experiences with the group. If you have any questions, please reach out.

name: MHS Comet Cadtes
description:
Built upon the values and principles of the military mindset, the Comet Cadets are students working to become better citizens and leaders through class based learning and community involvement. 
Our meetings will have a variety of topics, including;
Military Drill Instruction 
Team Building and Physical Fitness Activities 
Character Development Lessons
Community Service 
Science and Technology Discussion 
Strategy and Critical Thinking Analysis

name: MHS Economics Club
description: The MHS Economics Club will be an extension of the YEI (Youth Economics Initiative) chapter. Building upon the strong foundation laid by the YEI, the club aims to provide an immersive and enriching experience for students interested in economics and its multifaceted applications. The club will serve as a hub of intellectual exploration and collaborative engagement, where passionate economic enthusiasts can delve deeper into economic concepts, engage in thought-provoking discussions, and actively contribute to enhancing financial literacy within our school community.

name: MHS Fashion Club
description: Join our meetings for workshops, discussions, activities and more! Our club provides a unique opportunity for students to get involved in thrift flips, fashion shows, student run met galas, and so much more. We encourage individuals to express their identity through their clothing and meet others doing the same! Join our Schoology page or follow our Instagram for more information.

name: MHS Future Business Leaders of America
description: Future Business Leaders of America  is the largest business Career and Technical Student Organization in the world with over 230,000 members. We prepare the next generation of business and technology leaders and entrepreneurs.
sectionOneContent: You must be enrolled in or plan to take three business courses here at MHS to be considered for FBLA membership.

name: MHS Girls Four Girls
description: Girls 4 Girls provides girls a safe space to come together, share stories, discuss important topics, get advice, & make friends who empower each other to be more confident. We believe that girls need girls. Sometimes, we just need a chance to get together and talk about the things that matter, including friendships, relationships, pressures, expectations, confidence, overcoming fears, and so much more. Our goal is to unite girls in their schools and worldwide, inspire authentic confidence, and support one another to be kinder to ourselves and each other.

name: MHS Humor Club
description: Homework, Examinations, and other assignments are some of common stressors in the average high school student. Humor Club is a place where stress and anxiety no longer exist. It’s a friendly place where members can perform stand up comedy, create memes, and just simply tell jokes to let their stress out. We meet 1-2 times a month on Fridays to relieve stress and come together as MHS. We also have many volunteering outreach events all throughout the year.

name: MHS INTERalliance Chapter
description: Monthly meetings to assist students planning to pursue a career in IT/Computer science through monthly chapter competitions and advocating for Techolympics, the largest student-run tech conference in the country.
additionalTitle: Chief Operations Officer for the INTERalliance of Greater Cincinnati

name: MHS Math Team
description: At Math Team, we participate in a lot of challenging math competitions and sometimes go over the questions together. From time to time, we also put out our own problem sets over specific topics and discuss them together in a fun environment after school.

name: MHS Med Club
description: Are you interested in pursuing a career in medicine? Then join the Mason High School Med Club a club dedicated to giving back to the healthcare field and learning more about professions, work style, and college for the medical field! We have 1-2 meetings per month on Tuesdays in A211 from 2:30-3:30 and snacks will be provided. Join us to make a difference in your community through health sciences.

name: MHS Mock Trial
description: Improve your critical thinking skills while learning how Constitutional law works. Members form teams to par­tic­i­pate in an orig­i­nal sim­u­lated trial as witnesses or attorneys for plaintiff or defense . The case in presented in real court­rooms (in Warren, Butler, or Clermont counties).  The state fi­nals are held in the Ohio State­house and the win­ner ad­vances to the na­tional com­pe­ti­tion.

name: MHS Rock Climbing
description: The Mason Rock Climbing club introduces students to the unique but challenging sport of Rock Climbing. The club will meet twice a month at Mosaic Climbing, where they members explore the various types of climbing: bouldering, which is a powerful and ropeless form of climbing, toprope, which is an endurance/distance based form of climbing, and speed. Climbers will work in group orientated settings where they collaborate together to crack tough climbs and push their limits!

name: MHS Scrub Club
description: A club to get students acclimated to what the medical field is, what it entails, and what it means to be a medical professional. Students will participate in labs, interview local medical professionals and learn several skills vital for success in healthcare.

name: MHS Spanish Club
description: This club is for anyone that has an interest in teaching, improving or learning Spanish in an inclusive environment! All are welcome!

name: MHS Unicef Club
description: Unicef Club serves to educate and advocate to students for children in third-world countries like Nigeria that don't have access to basic living necessities. We have 4 teams, education, sanitation, health, and protection that work together in their divisions to organize monthly events for club members and students. We partner with other clubs to organize donation drives, for items like sanitation products or even toys for underprivileged kids.

name: MHS Varsity Dance Team
description: MHS Varsity Dance Team is a competitive dance team that competes regionally and nationally. Dance styles consist of jazz, hip hop, and pom.  The team performs at halftime basketball games, pep rallys, and community events.
advisorName: Christina Huetter, Holly Phelps, and Morgan Elam

name: MHS Weightlifting
description: This club provides its members with a safe and fun space to work out with friends or a partner in the weight room afterschool.
sectionOneContent: Are you interested in joining a club where you can work out with your friends from school and build a strong community? Look no further! Our student-run high school weightlifting team is the perfect opportunity for you to strengthen your body, reach your goals, and join a supportive, encouraging community. Our club welcomes people of all skill levels and abilities as we partner up when exercising to create friendships and connect with others. This club provides plenty of opportunities to showcase your hard work. Join us to become part of a club that believes in the power of strength and community.
sectionTwoContent: The FinalForms for this club must be completed before participating in this club.

name: MHS-3DPC
description: In the MHS 3D Printing Club, you will be able to learn how to design 3D models, and how to use a 3D printer to turn your designs into functional products or tools, ranging from complex mechanisms to art pieces. You will learn the differences between different types of filament, such as impact strength, or flexibility. From learning what programs to use, to the science of how a 3D printer works, the MHS 3D Printing Club is the place to go for anything 3D-Printer related. Throughout the year, we hope to have various 3D Printing sales, where you will have the opportunity to sell your own 3D objects.

name: Model United Nations
description: Model UN is a club where students travel to colleges and compete against other high school students to speak, debate, and collaborate on a plethora of world issues. Such issues can range from nuclear disarmament, climate change, health crises, and even space races. Much like the actual UN, students work together to draft comprehensive resolutions that work to solve the issue at hand. Students who participate in this program become more comfortable with public speaking and sharing their ideas in larger groups, skills that stay with them throughout their lives.
sectionOneContent: Club members participate in many ways, and attending conferences is one of them. Modeled off of the United Nations, students from schools across the nation work with one another on addressing pressing issues at conferences, representing nations and individuals with differing viewpoints. Conferences are hosted by colleges and high schools both virtually and in person, and the club has attended conferences at the following colleges in the past: Indiana University, Ohio State University, UC Berkeley, Yale, Georgetown University, and American University. These conferences typically take place over multiple days, with multiple sessions devoted to tackling different topics under the larger structure of a single United Nations Committee or similar organizational body. After hours of fruitful debate and discussion, delegates vote on a comprehensive solution tailored to the topic that everyone participating agrees on, promoting amity, cooperation, and understanding between students.
sectionTwoContent: Every year, Model UN hosts a conference of their own! The 2021-2022 school year marks the seventh iteration of Mason High School’s conference, with WilmaMUN II, following the renaming of the conference during the 2019-2020 school year (formerly known as WMHSMUN). Club members take time to create committees on their own to run them for delegates from local high schools. Topics and content vary widely, emphasizing creativity and originality with past committees including: The Eagle And Dragon: War In The South China Sea, Operation Nowhere and Entree: Murder Mystery, and 2100, Turn of the Century: The Race to Relocate and Reallocate in Global Climate Catastrophe. Every member will have the opportunity to present an idea to be voted upon and selected by the club, so we’re looking forward to seeing your submissions this fall!
sectionThreeContent: Model UN is the definition of a student run organization. The seven member leadership team is elected by the club every spring in a comprehensive process designed to eliminate all possible bias. But leadership also extends beyond elected positions, with each and every member expected to lead from within. Whether it be in committee, where you may lead your bloc of like minded delegates to advocate for your solution, or in preparation for WilmaMUN where you may lead a team of fellow club members to create a committee to follow your vision. Leadership is essential in Model UN, no matter who you are.

name: Moot Court
description: Moot Court allows students to present oral arguments and take the stand in front of a panel of judges. During the preparation process, students will refine and develop their knowledge of case law, the appellate court system, and practice forming cogent and compelling arguments.

name: National Art Honor Society
description: The National Art Honor Society (NAHS) was founded in 1978 to inspire and recognize scholarship and art in the development of creativity, character, service and leadership. NAHS strives to aid members in working toward the attainment of the highest standards in art areas, and to bring art education to the attention of the school and community.  Membership in NAHS is both an honor and a commitment.

name: National Business Honor Society
description: An honor society dedicated to members passionate about business!
sectionTwoContent: In addition to the application process, here are some of the requirements: a student must be a high school junior or senior.  The student must have completed or be currently enrolled in his/her third business course and must complete a business course each year of membership. The student must have a minimum standard GPA, on a 4.0 scale, as follows: business courses average-3.6; overall average-3.65.

name: National Chinese Honor Society
description: NCHS members actively engage in, explore, and promote Chinese culture in and outside of the school community.
sectionOneContent: You must be in the course Mandarin II or above to join. Native speakers may also join. Applications for new members are available each spring.
sectionTwoContent: Members are expected to attend mandatory meetings and will need 8 total volunteer hours per year. At least 2 volunteer hours must come from tutoring Mandarin students (NCHS will host tutoring sessions).

name: National Honor Society
description:
The National Honor Society was established in 1921 to recognize outstanding high school students. More than just an honor roll, it serves to honor those students who have demonstrated excellence in the areas of Scholarship, Leadership, Service, and Character. Chapter membership challenges members to develop further through active involvement in school activities and community service.

National Honor Society requires that all students demonstrate their commitment to the four pillars in a holistic application. The NHS membership application is open to tenth and eleventh graders. The application opens in January of each year.

name: Photo Club
description: Photo Club is for anyone who has a love of photography and taking photos!  We do photo shoots and travel to different locations to take photos!

name: Red Cross
description: Red Cross is  a service oriented club that is an extension of the American Red Cross.  We work to do different service projects to benefit the American Red Cross's lines of service, as well as to help our community.

name: Red Cross Club
description: The American Red Cross “prevents and alleviates human suffering in the face of emergencies by mobilizing the power of volunteers and the generosity of donors”. As the MHS Red Cross Club, we work together by supporting and encouraging this mission with service events throughout our community.
sectionOneContent:
From the American Red Cross, there are 5 main lines of service that they work with specifically. We have decided to split our members up and have 5 committees, one for each line of service. The goal is for each committee to come up with a service project related to that line or service so we can have our members more involved in the process, and reach the requirement for a red cross club. Below is a description of each line of service. 
Disaster Services
Disaster relief focuses not only on the most urgent disaster response efforts but prevention and preparedness as well. On any given day, when a disaster strikes, Disaster Action Teams and local caseworkers are deployed on-site, stationed at shelters, and on standby at local Red Cross chapters to help those affected receive the food, care, and basic resources they need to recover.
Service to the Armed Forces
This branch of the American Red Cross focuses on active service members, veterans, and their families. Emergency communications services play a central role—uniting families with the armed forces, connecting military hospitals and wounded warrior units, providing assistance in health care facilities, and more.
Training Services
Training and preparedness education are key facets to the Training Services branch. These training hope to enable those certified to prevent, prepare for, and respond in a number of life-threatening scenarios
Blood Services (Biomedical Services)
One of the most well-known of the five lines of services, the American Red Cross Blood Services branch provides a life-saving supply of blood. 
International Services
The Red Cross strengthens leadership, financial management, volunteer networks, and supports the global movement. When disasters arise, American Red Cross volunteers are deployed to these locations in order to provide the most direct assistance to affected homes and families

name: Rock Climbing Club
description: We are a club of amateur rock climbers who love to get together and climb. Climbing is primarily an individual sport: you're goal is to improve your own technique, strength, and mind. But, when you climb with others, it becomes a really great communal sport. We aim to be a supportive club for both beginners and those wanting to get really good at climbing. At the base of it, all we want to do is have fun and climb stuff. All our welcome!

name: Science Bowl
description: A fast-paced quiz bowl testing on 5 main sciences- Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Earth Science, and Math. Students in this club go in-depth into the sciences to not only compete with other schools, but foster a love for science for oneself.

name: Science Fair
description: MHS science fair is a competitive event, hosted by the district. Students present their science project results in the form of a report, display board, and/or models that they have created to volunteer judges from the community.  Science fair allows students to investigate and compete in science, engineering and/or technology topics that they have personal interest in and allows students to enhance their understanding, research, experimentation skills on a personal level with the opportunity to move on to regional, state or international fair competitions.

name: Science National Honors Society
description: A science-based honors society based upon character, leadership, and service. Through guest speakers and enrichment sessions, we enrich our Mason community with scientific opportunities. We serve as scientific leaders serving to help our peers foster and develop a passion for science. Within the club, we offer opportunities for our members to engage in team-based experiments and design challenges through our monthly meetings.
additionalName: Science National Honors Society Leadership Team

name: Science Olympiad
description:
Science Olympiad is a nation-wide competition that features 23 different science-related events. Our coach always compares it to a "track team for SCIENCE." Teams of 15 students compete in groups of 2 or 3 in various STEM events. They can range from building and engineering to research and laboratory, covering topics surrounding physics, chemistry, biology, and technology.

Science Olympiad is a program that promotes strong team bonds, leadership, and above all else, fosters a passion for STEM.
sectionOneContent: Science Olympiad is a nation-wide, team-based competition that features 23 different STEM events. Our coach always compares it to a “track team for SCIENCE”; each individual event contributes to our overall team score. Teams of 15 students represent Mason, and groups of 2 or 3 students compete in each event. The 23 events are build-based, laboratory-based, or study and research-based, and the STEM focus of each event surrounds biology, life sciences, chemistry, physics, earth and space sciences, engineering, and/or technology. Most competitors will choose to compete in 2 to 5 events that spark their interest in any given season.
sectionTwoContent: Mason typically sends 2 or 3 teams to each competition, so up to 45 students represent our school every time. Since teams switch frequently throughout the season, students work with many different partners across the school year. Competition trips are usually overnight on Saturdays, at a high school or university either in-state or out-of-state, and Mason competes at ~10 competitions per season starting in December. Attending competitions eventually prepares us for the Regional, State, and National Tournament in May (which we won for the first time in 2021!).  Additionally, Mason Science Olympiad runs an Invitational of our own each spring where we host teams from different schools. This is an opportunity to better our understanding of each event, meet fellow Science Olympians across the nation, and give back to the Science Olympiad community.
sectionThreeContent: Aside from the first couple months of the school year where we learn and brainstorm for each event together, this club has no recurring meetings; the time commitment is entirely self-decided. For each competitor, the season consists of both individual and collaborative preparation, exciting competition trips, and many, many memories. Ultimately, Science Olympiad is a program that promotes strong team bonds, leadership, and above all else, fosters a passion for STEM.

name: SIBS
description: SIBS is a group of carefully selected upperclassmen who provide mentoring to the freshmen class, and awareness of social isolation and inclusion.  The SIBS meet their assigned freshmen during a Freshmen Orientation Day, and about 4-5 SIBS are assigned to each freshmen homeroom.  The SIBS also welcome and tour new students, perform community service, and engage in events that promote inclusivity and combat social isolation.

name: Sound Engineering and Music Production Club
description: SEMP.C aims to provide it's members with a substantial and sound "zero-to-one-hundred" education plan which assists them in producing music through the means of computers and music production software.

name: Spanish National Honor Society
description: The purpose of this organization is to recognize high school scholastic achievement in the study of Spanish and to promote interest in the study of the Spanish language and Hispanic/Spanish culture.

name: Speakeasy
description: Want to help others with their English? Speakeasy is a conversational tutoring club focused on helping others improve their English speaking and listening skills. This club is a great way to help your local community and make an impact; it is also an opportunity to make new friends and learn things about other cultures and countries. This club takes place during connect time on Wednesdays. If you're interested in being a tutor, feel free to join our Schoology page.

name: Student Government
description: Student Government is one of the largest clubs at MHS, and plans huge school wide events like: Hoco Parade, Hoco Dance, Pep Rally, Spirit Week, and Kids Count! We are a super hands-on interactive club teaching our members about leadership through running these events, while having a great time bonding together! Schoology Access Code: TCMDJ-TJ2FP

name: Tabletop Gaming Club
description: This club meets once a week after school to play tabletop games.  This can include board games, card games, roleplaying games, Dungeons & Dragons, etc.  The club has a large library of games, or you are free to bring in your own.  Please contact Mr. Schnell (room A313) with any questions!

name: TedX MHS
description: TedX seeks to provide an opportunity for skilled individuals to create a space to showcase their interest in storytelling. Speakers and Organizers will be involved in the development of a main event held at the end of the school year. Student speakers will have the chance to share their perspective and engage with the community; while organizers dedicate their time to finding speakers and coordinating events. Throughout the year, various topics and interests of members will be integrated, to form a cohesive theme for each year’s final event. Members play a crucial role in the progress and direction of this club; leadership opportunities will be available. To learn more about our club, join the TedX Schoology page!

name: The Black Hole
description: The Black Hole is the MHS student section. Every Friday night under the lights, you won’t be able to find a group of people as loud and cheerful as us. We have many different chants that support the Comets and get everyone hyped up for the games.

name: The Chronicle
description: The Chronicle is Mason High School's student produced newspaper. Students on The Chronicle must be enrolled in the Journalism courses at MHS. Students on the staff are required to go through an application process. The Chronicle is always looking for photographers, writers, reporters, designers, and webmasters. Students who want to be on The Chronicle staff are encouraged to speak to the advisor/instructor or any member of the staff to learn more about the application and acceptance process.

name: The Good Book Club
description: The Good Book Club is a student-led Bible study.  We read the Bible out loud and discuss what's been read.  All students are welcome.  All that is needed is a curiosity as to what is really in the Bible.  The Good Book Club is a safe place to find out for yourself and to ask questions.  All grade levels are welcome.  There are no prerequisites.

name: Women in business
description: Women in business is a club where like-minded women can come together and empower others to pursue a career in business. We hope to educate women about different fields in the business world.

name: Women in STEM
description: MHS Women in STEM seeks to inspire young women to become leaders in the STEM community and to advocate for gender equality in STEM fields. We connect members with internships and summer programs, host guest speakers, and hold events that raise awareness of the gender inequalities within STEM fields. We also have opportunities for students to explore their unique interests and learn more about different fields of STEM.
sectionOneTitle: What does a typical meeting look like?
sectionOneContent: We will feature a different STEM career each meeting. Hopefully, these small snippets of STEM careers will help you find possible careers! We will also try to feature different college/summer STEM programs so members can get insight into possible opportunities they want to pursue. This club will also be an advocate for gender equality in the STEM industry. We will work as a club to speak out for change. Some meetings we will have a guest speaker to help members learn more about a certain career! We are open to all new ideas! We look forward to hearing member's ideas for the club!
sectionTwoContent: Join our schoology group using access code QV6G-F2P9-P93CW to stay up to date on upcoming meetings and events. Follow our club on Instagram @masonwomeninstem to stay connected with what our club is doing! Reach out to mhswomeninstem@gmail.com or DM us on Instagram if you have any questions about joining our club! We take members all year, so just look on schoology to see when our next meeting is, and show up!!

name: Writers' Block
description: Writers' Block is Mason High School's literary magazine.  It is published once each year in the spring and features writing and artwork from Mason students.  The goal of the club is to produce the magazine and highlight the artistic talents of our students.

name: Young Leaders in Public Health & Medicine
description: MHS Young Leaders in Public Health and Medicine (YLPHM) is a chapter branch of the National YLPHM. It is a youth medical initiative that aspires to improve our world by providing future physicians and public health officials with the experience, opportunities, and leadership skills they need to succeed. MHS YLPHM helps students with common interests in Medicine and Public Health to help our community.

name: Young Women's Club and Honor Society
description: Our club is for any female students in grades 9-12. Young women's club focuses on activities that build each other up and bring awareness to issues women face. We also provide service-oriented opportunities that help women locally as well as globally in an effort to build a stronger community for the women in MHS!

name: Youth Cancer Society
description: MHS Youth Cancer Society raises awareness for types of cancer, fundraises for cancer research, advocates for the government's involvement in the cancer community, as well as has a hands-on approach in the cancer community by writing cards, giving toys, etc. Join this club to create numerous large-scale and beneficial events as well as have an impact in the cancer community!
